summary.royalty_percentages_explanation: A 10% royalty percentage is a standard rate in the automotive accessory industry, balancing profitability and competitiveness.
summary.market_assumptions: The motorcycle accessory market is expected to grow with increased customization trends and a rise in motorcycle usage globally.
summary.growth_projections_reasoning: Projected sales volumes increase annually due to market expansion and the bundling strategy improving ease of purchase for customers and dealers.
summary.industry_standards: Royalty rates in similar industries range from 5% to 15%, depending on brand strength, market position, and product uniqueness.

comparable_projects.name: Harley-Davidson Accessory Bundles
comparable_projects.description: Harley-Davidson offers bundled accessories for their bikes, providing discounts similar to individual accessory pricing.
comparable_projects.royalty_details: Operates at a 10% royalty rate, with bundled discounts incentivizing customer purchases.

comparable_projects.name: Ducati Performance Parts
comparable_projects.description: Ducati provides performance parts in bundles, targeting enthusiasts looking for enhanced performance.
comparable_projects.royalty_details: Typically, a 12% royalty is applied, reflecting the premium market and performance orientation.

comparable_projects.name: Yamaha Motorcycle Kits
comparable_projects.description: Yamaha offers complete kits that include several parts for specific motorcycle models.
comparable_projects.royalty_details: A 7% royalty rate is applied, allowing competitive pricing in the broader market.

methodology.data_sources: Data is based on industry reports, competitor analysis, and market research studies.
methodology.assumptions: Assumed steady market growth and acceptance of bundled products by dealership networks and end customers.
